content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Search for a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe on Allrecipes that includes ingredients like olives, has at least a 4-star rating, and more than 25 reviews. Detail the ingredients, cooking method, and total time required for preparation and cooking.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To search for a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe that includes olives, I should use the search functionality. The search textbox is visible at [2] and the search button at [3]. I will enter a query like "Mediterranean grilled fish olives" to find suitable recipes.
Action: Type [2]; Mediterranean grilled fish olives
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results have loaded and the first two recipes ("Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish" at [9] and "Branzino Mediterranean" at [10]) appear to be grilled fish dishes that may include olives. I need to check the details of one recipe to verify if it matches the task requirements, starting with the "Branzino Mediterranean" at [10] which seems likely to be grilled and Mediterranean-style.
Action: Click [10]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Branzino Mediterranean" recipe has a 4.8-star rating and 38 reviews, meeting the rating and review requirements. I need to ensure it includes olives and then detail the ingredients, cooking method, and total time. I should scroll down to see the ingredients and directions.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view shows the highlighted dish image, but not the ingredients list or cooking method. I need to scroll down further to access the complete recipe details which includes ingredients, method, and total preparation/cooking time.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Ingredients" heading is now visible, suggesting that the ingredient list is just below. However, the actual ingredient list is not yet visible. I need to scroll down a bit further to view the complete list of ingredients for this recipe.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The ingredients list is partially visible; it includes seasonings, lemon, rosemary, white wine, oregano, and parsley, but no olives are shown yet. I need to scroll further to see more ingredients and confirm if olives are included in the recipe.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The cooking instructions section is becoming visible, starting with oven preheating and use of olive oil, but neither all steps nor the full method are visible yet. I need to scroll further down to see the complete cooking method and check for olives in either the ingredient list or cooking instructions.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: More of the cooking method is visible, detailing stuffing the fish and adding ingredients to the baking pan. However, there is still no mention of olives so far in the method or the ingredient list. I need to continue scrolling to review all steps and ingredients to confirm if olives are included.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The final step of the recipe is now visible, detailing the baking process, but there is still no mention or sight of olives in the ingredients or steps. This recipe does not meet the requirement for including olives. I should go back to the search results and look for another Mediterranean grilled fish recipe that may include olives.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am now back at the search results/details page for "Branzino Mediterranean." The previous recipe did not include olives, so I need to look for another option. The next visible Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe from the previous search results page was "Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish." I should click on this option to check if it includes olives and fulfills the other requirements.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.72
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I appear to have been redirected to a general "Recipes" category page rather than to the next specific recipe ("Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish"). I need to return to the search results for "Mediterranean grilled fish olives" to find and select the next appropriate recipe.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am back on the "Branzino Mediterranean" recipe page, which I have already determined does not include olives. To find a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe with olives, I need to return to the previous search results page and select another recipe to check.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am still on the "Branzino Mediterranean" recipe detail page, which is not helpful for progressing toward finding a Mediterranean-style grilled fish recipe with olives. I need to return to the original search results list to explore another recipe.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am back at the search results for "Mediterranean grilled fish olives." The first result, "Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish" at [9], seems most likely to include olives and fits the Mediterranean grilled fish theme. I should check this recipe for olives and the other requirements.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The recipe "Mediterranean Stuffed Swordfish" has a 4.6-star rating and 57 reviews, meeting the rating and review requirements. The description mentions spinach and feta cheese, but not olives yet. I need to scroll down and check the ingredient list to confirm if olives are included, and also note the ingredients, method, and total time for the recipe.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current section displays images (possibly step images or gallery) and ad banners instead of the ingredient list or cooking instructions. To reach the recipe details, I need to scroll further down the page.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.81
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Ingredients" section has just started to appear, with the first ingredient (swordfish steak) visible. To check if olives are included and see the rest of the ingredient list, I need to scroll down further.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.83

Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <button> "Save", "Save Recipe";	[3]: <button> "Rate", "Rate It";	[4]: "Log In";	[6]: "Join for free: Use MyRecipes to save 100K+ recipes from Allrecipes and more";	[7]: <button> "Close";	[11]: "1 teaspoon olive oil";	[12]: "1 clove garlic, minced";	[13]: "2 cups fresh spinach - rinsed, dried and torn into bite size pieces";	[14]: "¼ cup crumbled feta";	[15]: "Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil grate.";

content:

Since the list may not be complete, I need to scroll further to ensure all ingredients are shown and confirm if olives are included.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
